intro: Lonicera strophiophora f. glabrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf honeysuckle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caprifoliaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are generally smooth and glabrous. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, which bloom in the spring. It is native to the southeastern United States and thrives in moist, wooded areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural landscapes.
